description:
Demolition of existing buildings and the erection of a
building comprising basement/lower ground  ground and
five upper storeys with a sixth floor plant room for
Business Use (B1)
as shown on drawing numbers 893/48B  49A  50  51A  52A
53A  54A  55C  56A   57  58A  59A  60A  61  68 & 893/4.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The details of the elevations and facing materials to be
    used on the building shall not be otherwise than as shall
    have been submitted to and approved by the Council before
    any work on the site is commenced.

Condition : 2 - The building at 1-23 Farringdon Road and 23-25 Charterhouse
    permission.
    Street shall be used for the cleaning, sorting, sale, and
    distribution of rough diamonds and other uses directly
    associated with the jewellery trade and for no other
    purpose (including any other purpose within Class B1 of the
    schedule of the Town and Country Planning Use Classes Order
    1987, or in any permision equivalent to that Class in any
    statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that order)
    for a period not exceeding five years from the date of this

Condition : 3 - Details of access with regards to contractors vehicles and
    vans during building operations shall be submitted to the
    Council before any works commence on site.

Condition : 4 - The developer shall afford access at all reasonable times
    to any archaeologist nominated by the Council and shall
    allow her/him to observe the excavations and record items
    of interest and finds.

Condition : 5 - The developer shall ensure that an archaeological
    investigation and excavation is carried out on the site of
    17-23 Farringdon Road, after demolition and clearance and
    before any development. All archaeological work shall be to
    the general satisfaction of the Council, to include prior
    approval by the Council of the specification of the Council,
    to include prior approval by the Council of the
    specification, programming

Condition : 6 - No construction shall take place until a detailed design
    and method statement for all the foundations and other
    development proposed below ground level in respect of No's
    17-23 Farringdon Road which takes account of the proposed
    running tunnels of the Cross Rail Project including
    underground movements arising from the construction of the
    Cross Rail tunnels; has been submitted to and approved by
    the Council.

Condition : 7 - No development shall take place until a scheme protecting
    the proposed building in respect of No's 17-23 Farringdon
    Road from noise/vibration arising from the construction and
    subsequent use of the Cross Rail Project has been submitted
    and approved by the Council; and all works which form part
    of the scheme shall be completed before any of the
    buildings hereby permitted are occupied.

Condition : 8 - No development shall take place until a scheme protecting
    the proposed buildings in respect of 17-23 Farringdon Road
    from electrical interference from the adjacent line
    installation during the subsequent use of the Cross Rail
    Project has been submitted to and approved by the Council;
    and all works which form part of such scheme shall be
    completed before any of the buildings hereby permitted are
    occupied. and archaeological organisation proposed for
    carrying out such work.

Condition : 9 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building.

Condition : 10 - To ensure that the future occupation of the building shall
    be in accordance with the Council's policy for offices as
    set out in the Written Statement of the London Borough of
    Camden Local Plan 1987 (the Borough Plan).

Condition : 11 - In order that the Council may give consideration to this
    matter and minimize noise disturbance and other nuisance in
    the immediate area.

Condition : 12 - To ensure that there is an opportunity to investigate this
    site which is considered to be of archaeological interest.

Condition : 13 - To safeguard the heritage of the Borough by providing an
    adequate opportunity to investigate and excavate
    archaeological remains on this site before development is
    carried out.
Condition : 14 - - 08. So as to safeguard the Cross Rail proposals.

Condition : 15 - 01As agreed the Council will now treat as withdrawn
    Application PL/8900630for the removal of additional
    condition 02 of planning permission dated6th June 1988 (Reg.
    No. PL/8800068/R1).
